answers.answer: The doctor knows best. They probably don't see a reason to induce you.

Well unfortunately  you don't get to choose the size of your baby. ..8 pounds is average. Plus that's just an estimate. You won't know the weight until your baby is born.  Those ultrasounds  can be off by a couple pounds. ..so your baby could only weigh 6 pounds right now. You don't really have a choice but to wait it out.
I kno. My daughter was 10 lbs just scares me because I ripe do bad I could walk for weeks & had a hard time healing.
Try a sitz  bath after delivery

Well there are things you can do to help prevent tearing again. Don't push on your back! Get upright! Have your baby on your hands and knees! In any position besides your back your chances of tearing go down so much.  I don't think it's good to induce for what you've said. I'm sure it will all work out fine.  Stay positive!

The doctor won't induce you unless there is a medical reason to. I know everyone says 37 weeks is full term but the baby still needs those extra weeks to grow. I had to be induced due to pre eclampsia and i really wish i hadnt been. I wish he could have had those extra 3 weeks even though i was extremely miserable - i couldn't even get out of bed - just wait it out and let him come when he is ready. 8lbs is not a big baby.

Google evening primrose oil!  Not only does it efface you but i beleive it helps in not tearing by keeping you lunercated!  You can also take your thumb and start rubbing gently at the bottom of your vagina hole.  My sister inlaw has big babies and thats what her doc told her to do...start streching yourself with your thumb!
The weight is just an estimate so I really wouldn't go by that but your doctor should know best and the baby does need those extra few weeks to develop more

8lbs isn't a big baby just worried because they said he's in the 95%, & he's gaining faster then average.  Just don't want to wait too long because he will be bigger & his belly measures to be kind of abnormally big, not sure what that means & that I have too much fluid, so I have to do a stress test & also another ultrasound. My dr said i was full term & she will induce me a week before. I'm def almost 3 cm dilated 70% effaced. I just wish she swept my membranes.

Can't help it. I can barley walk & been in so much pain. Just feel like crying my eyes out because it's sharp pains every time I sit up, walk, I can barley make it to the bathroom.  It's pathetic. No one should have to feel this way:(

Do u have gestational diabetes?..I have this same exact thing going on. I don't have the extra fluid but my baby is measuring big and has a bigger belly and I was told it was due to my gestational diabetes, but that he is just fine just a bigger baby. And because of his bigger size and the diabetes they are inducing me tomorrow because my dr. Says bigger baby's can get stuck, or have birth injuries or other complications. I'm not sure what your situation is, but most Dr.s will induce or c section if your baby ends up being too big. Ultrasounds can be off up to 2 pounds. With my first son they told me all the time he was gonna be this Biggs baby, but he only weighed 7 lbs 10oz. I do feel the baby I'm carrying now is bigger than my first and I'm sure he is but we won't know for sure till he is out. Try not to worry, and talk about your concerns with dr. Good luck and congrats!
Forgot to mention I'm 37 weeks and being induced tomorrow...
Faith that's part of pregnancy.  It isn't easy.

Thank you all. I feel alot better hearing from all of you! I'm just going to wait it out & talk to my doctor in another week. Just hope hes doing ok. & no i dont have diabetes. I just want a healthy baby that's a good 8lbs. Hope my ultrasound is off by just a little

question: I'm only 37 weeks but my baby is already 8lbs. I been in so much pain plus I have extra fluid, which I guess is not a good thing. My dr. Seems uncaring about me or my baby.:( I don't want a huge baby. 8lbs is good, ready to have him now! What would you do?!!!
title: shouldn't I be induced? ??!!#!!
